title: Moonlight star Alex R. Hibbert , 12, wants to spend his earnings on cancer research | Metro News
text:
Olivia Waring for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 8:17 am Alex R. Hibbert wants to change the world for the better after his starring role in Moonlight (Picture: Getty) 
The child star of Oscars favourite Moonlight has vowed to build a cancer research laboratory with his earnings. Sponsored 13 realities of going wedding dress shopping 
Following his break-out role in Barry Jenkins’ latest movie, 12-year-old Alex R. Hibbert has decided to give up his footballing dreams and his ambition to become a scientist. 
Instead, he will use his acting readies (well, some of it) to make a huge difference to people’s lives. Alex with Mahershala Ali in Moonlight (Picture: A24) 
He told HeyUGuys : ‘Football is out of the question now, but scientist-wise, I’m going to take most of my money… wait, some of my money, and build a lab. 
‘And I’m going to take the best scientists to work on curing cancer and stuff like that.’ Alex with Trevante Rhodes and Ashton Sanders who both played older versions of his character (Picture: Instagram) 
Blimey, we wish we’d been that selfless at the age of 12. 
After being plucked out of obscurity via an open audition, it sounds like acting has played a very positive role in the Florida native’s life.
